ygData.subject: Re: the road less traveled...
ygData.msgSnippet: hiya walt and all i can tell you is i solo ed alot at that lvl, but this is important, if you are the sole healer of the group, you must first know if they
ygData.messageBody:
hiya walt and all i can tell you is i solo'ed alot at that lvl, but this is
important, if you are the sole healer of the group, you must first know if
they want you in melee or healin capassity. If you are the healer then you
have to tell yer party that the fighting and downtime go accourding to yer
manna, plain and simple!! if they want you to heal then they have to wait
for yer manna to be at full unless its a lil thing that they can do without
you, in that case you med while they fight. you will find that you are in
higher demand when you get to higher lvls. just be patient and let them
know right from the start that you may not be the leader of the group but
the fighting does run on yer time, not theirs, as you are the one healing,
and if they want you to melee then they should not expect heals at critical
moments

>From: "Walt Zimbeck" <wzimbeck@...>
>Reply-To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>To: <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
>Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] the road less traveled...
>Date: Sun, 19 Sep 1999 18:18:39 -0500
>
>From: "Walt Zimbeck" <wzimbeck@...>
>
>I have been following this thread with considerable interest. I am running
>a high elf cleric on Erollisi Marr who is currently nine. My problem is
>that is hard to get into a group since a lot still want to solo at this age
>level and the groups that do offer want to either go to Crushbone or like
>today to the Chessboard. When I have grouped I try to aid in melee and
>still watch the health of the party members. I do not use Furor at all in
>combat saving my mana for healing and buffing only. I have also had a
>group
>not give me a chance to med back to even 50% before starting to fight
>again.
>Another problem of course is that once I begin to heal the mob starts
>beating on me and they cannot pull it off. I try not to fight back when
>this happens to give them a chance to get it off me though.
>
>I did manage to purchase a couple of 2 wisdom rings today for a total of
>2pp. These are the first stat enhancing items I have gotten. As usual I
>am
>almost completely broke now after buying my ninth level spells and the
>rings. I am still wearing a mixture of leather, PW and cloth armor and
>using a cracked staff in combat.
>
>I am open to any and all suggestions that you elders my wish to impart upon
>me.
>
>Thank you,
>Yilari
>
>
>
>

Topaaz / LadyJay - *Power Corrupts and absolute Power corrupts absolutly*
*hugs*
